snippet: A robust job growth number from the Labor Department came on the heels of a flurry of heartening economic news.
abstract: Labor Department report finds unemployment rate fell to 8.5 percent in December 2011, lowest level in nearly three years; shows that employers added 200,000 jobs in what was the sixth consecutive month that the economy showed a net gain of more than 100,000 jobs; Pres Obama offers tempered response to report, but gains are seen as significant boost to his re-election prospects.
lead_paragraph: A robust job growth number from the Labor Department came on the heels of a flurry of heartening economic news.

headline.main: U.S. Economy Gains Steam as 200,000 Jobs Are Added
headline.print_headline: 200,000 New Jobs Are Positive Sign In U.S. Recovery
